posts.post_content:
@ John-Bender  
  
I don't think it's been replaced by [Nemesis of Reason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nemesis of Reason) because it still needs to attack after you played it. Before you get to do that your opponent can remove it somehow, enchant it (with [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism) for example) or do whatever else to it.  
[Glimpse the Unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse the Unthinkable) can only be avoided by countering it (or changing the target of the spell which would be even more frustrating ^^) otherwise it'll happen!  
  
I'm a huge fan of sorceries as you see...^^

Posted By: nineyears (7/6/2009 2:44:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
***SICK CARD***  
  
I agree, this would be a good "scepter" card.. to bad though, right?  
  
How ever, If you can muster **5** colorless mana, (*impossible, I know*) then you can try to just "[Panoptic Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panoptic Mirror)" this card. Its basically the same thing..   
For **2** colorless mana each turn (*if you can dodge anti-affinity*) by the time you cast **3** copies of the imprinted [Glimpse the Unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse the Unthinkable) your average cost for the Mirror and all subsequent spells is **2.75**.  
**5 + 2 + 2 + 2 = 11**  
**11 / 4 = 2.75**  
  
..not too far off from "third cast" on [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter).  
  
*Hard investment.. But think about it this way, if your mirror gets destroyed that's 7 years bad luck for your opponent..*  
  
P.S. Szadek is the dude being quoted in the flavor text.. I don't think its about him.. who ever he is  
***P.P.S. SICK CARD***

posts.post_content: I like the art a lot, but the flavour text is pretty silly despite being quite fun. Surely Szadek of all people is intelligent enough to recognise how predictable his guild's real purpose was? As for the card itself, it does its job well but I find it somehow lacking some key spark of fun shared by both [Millstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Millstone) and its variants, and [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize).
posts.html:
I like the art a lot, but the flavour text is pretty silly despite being quite fun. Surely Szadek of all people is intelligent enough to recognise how predictable his guild's real purpose was? As for the card itself, it does its job well but I find it somehow lacking some key spark of fun shared by both Millstone and its variants, and Traumatize.

Posted By: John-Bender (7/3/2009 6:47:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Well a lot of people say that Glimpse of the Unthinkable and other milling cards such as Oona are rigged. But I disagree. Something to trivial is that a person has sixty cards and in most cases 20 life--if you can deal enough damage or do a one turn kill milling dosen't matter except the turn 3 combo win that uses milling. 20 is less than sixty, so it is easier in some cases to kill life. But my deck black/blue combines deck milling and revealing your hand and discarding cards, so in turn, it can ensure a win. But counters are a problem my deck sucks against--so I use Dread Return, Recover, and Raise Dead--which is good against destruction of creatures and plain out death. Removal is of high risk and against most decks is a pretty big foe. So take my advice and if you operate milling use x4 of Glimpse and combine your milling deck with Duress.
